Topic.Title: Example with gfx and / or sound?

Posts.EditableText: Anyone know a example game I can look at (play.. do not need source.. though that would be cool) that uses gfx or sound.... preferably that has been converted to android? I would like to see it in action if possible.
Posts.HTML: Anyone know a example game I can look at (play.. do not need source.. though that would be cool) that uses gfx or sound.... preferably that has been converted to android? I would like to see it in action if possible.

Posts.EditableText: Escape from Byron Bay makes use of some graphics and sounds, and is available on iOS and Android, although I'm not sure if the Android version has been officially released to the Play Store or not yet. I beta tested it for Alex though, so if it's not, it should be added in the near future. Also, I started developing a game using graphics and sound effects called Mutagenics, but I haven't really done much with it for a while. You can find it at http://www.textadventures.co.uk/review/713/ but you can't do much in it as of yet.
Posts.HTML:
Escape from Byron Bay makes use of some graphics and sounds, and is available on iOS and Android, although I'm not sure if the Android version has been officially released to the Play Store or not yet. I beta tested it for Alex though, so if it's not, it should be added in the near future.

Also, I started developing a game using graphics and sound effects called Mutagenics, but I haven't really done much with it for a while. You can find it at http://www.textadventures.co.uk/review/713/ but you can't do much in it as of yet.

Posts.EditableText: Yes Byron Bay is now available for Android. You can see all the apps here: http://www.textadventures.co.uk/apps/ Aventura Pirata shows an image at the start and uses sounds extensively throughout.
Posts.HTML:
Yes Byron Bay is now available for Android. You can see all the apps here: http://www.textadventures.co.uk/apps/

Aventura Pirata shows an image at the start and uses sounds extensively throughout.
